task_summary: Perceive the T-block and target, approach and align the circular tool, perform repeated diagonal pushes toward the target, then settle and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed tabletop scene shows a T-shaped block that must be pushed into a T-shaped target outline. A 6-DoF arm with a circular end-effector approaches the block, aligns its yaw to push along a diagonal and executes short pushes with intermittent re-localization and re-alignment. The goal is to translate and slightly re-orient the block until it overlaps the target outline. The sequence assumes 10 Hz observation and control, modest timeouts, and precise in-plane alignment before each push. The run ends with a brief settle and a safe retreat.
preconditions: Tabletop is clear except the T-block and target
End-effector free of obstacles; controller active at 10 Hz
stepwise_plan: Detect the T-block and the T-shaped target area
Move above the block and align laterally with tight tolerance
Set tool yaw for diagonal pushing toward the target
Repeat: push a short distance, re-detect the block, re-align
Let the block settle briefly and then retreat
success_criteria: T-blockâ€™s footprint overlaps the target outline
No loss of contact causing large block rotation
Robot retreats to a safe distance without collisions
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss: re-detect target/block and retry the cycle
Misalignment/deflection: re-align with looser tolerance and retry
Insufficient motion: increase number of push cycles
Unexpected contact: abort push and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Stop when overlap is achieved after the planned cycles and the robot executes the retreat, or when retries/timeouts exhaust.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Pre-push hover for safe lateral alignment.
Tight in-plane alignment to establish pushing pose.
Orient tool to push diagonally toward the target.
Re-localize the block after each push.
Let the block settle at target.
Back off to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Block occluded by tool leading to missed detections
Large rotation due to off-center contact
recovery_strategy: Re-detect and re-align between pushes (built-in Repeat loop)
Adjust yaw (manual) if consistent lateral drift is observed
Abort and retreat on repeated timeouts
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue target outline; instruction colors (gray/green/blue) differ. We follow the frames.
Target is planar and fixed; success judged by visual overlap.
10 Hz observation/control are environmental settings and not directly parameterized in the BT.

expected_success_criteria: Final frames depict the block aligned within the outline and the tool retreating
